metadata.dc:author: Fresquet Febrer, José Luis
metadata.dc:description: The purpose of this paper is to show that the writings of 16th century Spanish surgeons-doctors contain considerable information about everyday surgical practice. These usually neglected data may bring us to a better understanding of the development of this aspect of medical practice. Surgical writings analysed here are by Daza Chacon, Juan Fragoso, Juan Calvo, and Pedro Arias de Benavides.
metadata.dc:title: La práctica médica en los textos quirúrgicos españoles en el siglo XVI.
[Medical practice in Spanish surgical texts in the 16th century].
